sentence.Network_en: I suddenly have a bad case of horripilation. Was I being set up?

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent.: from late Latin horripilatio(n-), from Latin horrere 'stand on end' (see horrid) + pilus 'hair'

means.word_mean: 1. reflex erection of hairs of the skin in response to cold or emotional stress or skin irritation
